action: I want to securely store, search, and share business documents such as contracts, specifications, and internal materials
reason: Because I need to prevent document loss and accidental mis-sharing while achieving both operational efficiency and information security
acceptance_criteria: The system shall allow only authenticated users to upload documents.
The system must restrict document viewing privileges based on user roles and folder-level permissions.
The system shall automatically generate a globally unique Document ID for each file.
The system must restrict uploadable file formats to a specific allowlist (e.g., PDF, DOCX, XLSX) and enforce a configurable file size limit.
The system shall execute a virus scan on every uploaded file, rejecting infected files, and store valid files in an encrypted storage container.
The system must enforce HTTPS (TLS 1.2+) for all data transmission.
The system shall automatically record metadata including Creator, Creation Date, and Update Date.
The system must implement document version control, archiving previous versions and recording the updater's identity and timestamp for every change.
The system shall provide search functionality allowing filtering by Filename, Tags, Creator, and Date Range.
The system must use parameterized queries and input sanitization to prevent SQL injection and Cross-Site Scripting (XSS).
The system shall generate time-limited, signed tokens for shared links, invalidate them upon expiration, and support read-only access configurations.
The system must maintain a download history log capturing User ID, Document ID, and Timestamp.
The system shall support logical deletion of documents and record the operation in the audit log.
The system must process file operations asynchronously via a queue, implementing automatic retries (up to 3 times) for failures before logging an error.
The system shall generate specific logs for both successful uploads and failures.
The system must trigger alert notifications when document processing times violate defined Service Level Agreements (SLA).
The system shall provide document template management capabilities and retain a history of template modifications.
The system must store audit logs in tamper-evident storage to prevent modification.
The system shall include document data in regular backup schedules and log any backup failures.
The API must adhere to REST principles, support versioning, enforce rate limiting, and must not expose internal storage paths in responses.
